description:
Description:

Creation of FloatingIp after reaching its Maximum absolute limit value is throwing '(HTTP 500)' error.
As we are trying to create FloatingIp exceeding its limit, it is expected to throw error as '(HTTP 413)' but
not   '(HTTP 500)' 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Check the limit value for FloatingIp
2. Update the limit value for FloatingIp to '3'.
3. Check the Updated limit value for FloatingIp
4. Check the floating-ip-list and delete if any floating-ips exist
4. Create FloatingIps till the limit
5. Try to create floating limit after reaching the limit value

Expected Result:
Should raise OverLimit Exception i.e, (HTTP 413)

Actual Result:
The error thrown as "The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500)"

LOG:

muralik@ubuntu:~$ nova-manage project quota --project=16ec38e5a4024d8a842a8a5283602765

title: Creation of FloatingIp after reaching its Maximum absolute limit value is throwing  '(HTTP 500)' error

comments.content:
Description:

Creation of FloatingIp after reaching its Maximum absolute limit value is throwing '(HTTP 500)' error.
As we are trying to create FloatingIp exceeding its limit, it is expected to throw error as '(HTTP 413)' but
not   '(HTTP 500)' 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Check the limit value for FloatingIp
2. Update the limit value for FloatingIp to '3'.
3. Check the Updated limit value for FloatingIp
4. Check the floating-ip-list and delete if any floating-ips exist
4. Create FloatingIps till the limit
5. Try to create floating limit after reaching the limit value

Expected Result:
Should raise OverLimit Exception i.e, (HTTP 413)

Actual Result:
The error thrown as "The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500)"

LOG:

comments.content: 413 doesn't seem right to me, as it refers to the actual content of the http request.  A cursory glance elsewhere suggests that 403 is what we use when a quota is exceeded.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~andrewbogott

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/9738

comments.content:
My mistake, apparently 413 is used for this elsewhere.

Should be fixed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9738/

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/9738
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b0da2c4f4ed492f11c343852442e447073a5af76
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit b0da2c4f4ed492f11c343852442e447073a5af76
Author: Andrew Bogott <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Jul 12 01:26:02 2012 -0500

    When over quota for floating ips, return HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge.
    
    Previously we were returning a generic Internal Server Error which seems dumb.
    
    Fixes bug 1021721.
    
    Change-Id: Ia30b8de22bcc00d159bb4894ab4dc5f4870c346b
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: I've filed bug #1026167 about how this can be fixed better
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content:
https://review.openstack.org/9738 is actually addressing the wrong exception.

NoMoreFloatingIps is raised when the floating IP range is exhausted, whereas the case referred to in this bug is floating IP quota over-run, which is indicated by a FloatingIpLimitExceeded exception.

Now the FloatingIpLimitExceeded case is already reported as a 413, since the fix for bug #1021373 landed.

Whereas the initial patch for this bug is problematic, as it leads to a 500 Server Error due to the retry-after header being left unset on the HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge exception.

As noted on bug #1026167, I'd propose allowing the NoMoreFloatingIps exception to bubble up to the FaultWrapper middleware, and then treating this as a 404 as opposed to a 413.

The reasoning here is that NoMoreFloatingIps extends NotFound, which is in turn associated with the 404 status, so the intent appears to be that floating IP range exhaustion is treated as a free floating IP resource not being found.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~eglynn

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/10019
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/10019
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/ebc05b803615b78a14008136bb549a41013e6cd1
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit ebc05b803615b78a14008136bb549a41013e6cd1
Author: Eoghan Glynn <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Jul 19 16:19:49 2012 +0100

    Allow NoMoreFloatingIps to bubble up to FaultWrapper
    
    Fixes LP 1026167.
    
    The fix for LP 1021721 caught the wrong exception in order to
    address floating IP quota over-run. NoMoreFloatingIps is raised
    when the floating range is exhausted, whereas FloatingIpLimitExceeded
    is raised on over-quota.
    
    Also the HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge exception raised is mapped
    to 500 Server Error due to the required retry-after header being
    left unset.
    
    We now allow the NoMoreFloatingIps to bubble up to the FaultWrapper
    middleware, where its mapped to a 404 status due to it extending
    the NotFound exception.
    
    Change-Id: Id35c487113059ec3053f2f9e9e7eca24854ac02c
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
